channel.title: [PI] NPC Talking for Mod+
channel.description:
Hey,
I have been looking through a lot of UTube tuts, and things on Google, but I can't find anything which has anything about adding NPC talking; for example, I click on an NPC and where the chatbox is, it says - "Hello, how may I help?"
Normally it would be in NPCHandler.java: correct? I can't seem to find any examples of this in that file... :S
If anyone could give me a link to a guide, or give me a pointer, it would be much appreciated.
Also, if I wanted it so if a moderator talks to the NPC, there is an option only Mods can see and click on...
Cheers,
Chrome

item.title: [PI] NPC Talking for Mod+
item.dc:creator: @CoreVersion CoreVersion
item.description:
@CoreVersion wrote:

Well, for me, it would go something like this;

if ((objectID == ####) && (objectX == ####) && (objectY == ####)) { if (playerRights == 1337) { triggerTele(####, ####, 0); sM("Welcome to the fucking l33t zone bitches!"); } else { sM("Are you crazy? You need to be l33t to enter here... dumbass..."); } }

But, i’m not using PI, so i’m not sure what you’ll have to do with this, to make it work… :S
But, i’m sure it will be along the same lines, you can mess with that to make all sorts of things, such as training areas with cb requirements, staff and donator zones, tonnes of shit!

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] NPC Talking for Mod+
item.dc:creator: @Roar337 Roar337
item.description:
@Roar337 wrote:

if (c.playerRights >= 1){
//code for mod here
} else if (c.playerRights < 1){
//code for players here
}

item.title: [PI] NPC Talking for Mod+
item.dc:creator: @Chromeez Chromeez
item.description:
@Chromeez wrote:

Ooo,

I like the idea CoreVersion!

How would I set about doing that? I would make an object, which was a portal, then what would I do from there?

Cheers for the idea!

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] NPC Talking for Mod+
item.dc:creator: @CoreVersion CoreVersion
item.description:
@CoreVersion wrote:

Well, that’s certainly a good idea,
But let me suggest this; Maybe you could create portals, (like me teheeee :L) that have restrictions, so, you’ve got 2 portals lined up, one could be the staff zone for mods + and another could be for the donators…

This is quite easy to do, and if you change the object names in your client, you could even have them say Staff Portal, and Donator Portal, and change the examine info.
I know this isn’t what you asked for, but that’s about the only thing i can think of, and that’s what i did

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] NPC Talking for Mod+
item.dc:creator: @Chromeez Chromeez
item.description:
@Chromeez wrote:

Thank-you very much!

Is there a way of making certain options to Mod+ only, so normal players can’t see the Moderator options? So say I wanted an NPC which normally talks to people, but when a Mod comes, it has the same options, only an extra which will teleport them to the staff area?

Cheers,

Chrome

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] NPC Talking for Mod+
item.dc:creator: @Hot_Potato1 Hot_Potato
item.description:
@Hot_Potato1 wrote:

In DialogueHandler.java, add the code below under one of the case which looks similar to the code below.

case #: sendNpcChat4("text", "text", "text", "text", c.talkingNpc, "NPC name"); c.nextChat = #; // replace the '#' with a case number so it switches case, if you don't want it, leave it at 0 break;

Now in ActionHandler.java, search for:

Under it add:

case #: // replace '#' with the npc id c.getDH().sendDialogues(#, npcType); // replace '#' with the case number break;
Save, compile and you are done!

Read full topic
